title: FE-001-Landing Page Load
description: Verify landing page loads correctly with all sections
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8080", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Ship faster, decide smarter').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=ProductFlow Studio cuts through the noise. Get your team aligned, your data clear, and your next move obvious.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Three tools built for teams that move fast').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Real-time collaboration without the meeting overhead').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Dashboards that show you what matters, not noise').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Turn decisions into action').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=ProductFlow Studio transforms raw information into clarity. Watch patterns emerge that matter, cut through the static, and know exactly what to do next.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Your team stays connected without drowning in messages. Everyone knows the plan, sees the progress, and moves in the same direction.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Stop guessing. ProductFlow Studio gives you the facts you need to ship with certainty. Your decisions rest on solid ground, not hunches.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Priorities become clear. Distractions fade. You launch faster because you focus on what actually moves the needle for your users.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=From teams who ship faster').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=ProductFlow Studio killed our status meetings. We just check the dashboard and move on.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=We cut our decision cycle in half. The data is always there, always current, always honest.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Our team finally speaks the same language. No more guessing what anyone meant.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=No setup headaches, no learning curve that kills momentum').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Plug in your tools and data sources').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Your team sees the same picture').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Turn insight into action without the friction').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Simple pricing').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Starter plan').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=$19/mo').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Professional plan').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=$29/mo').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Enterprise plan').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=$49/mo').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Join teams that ship with clarity and confidence every day').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Stay in the loop').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Subscribe').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Everything you need to know about ProductFlow Studio').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Most teams are up and running in under an hour. Connect your tools, invite your people, and start seeing your data in one place. No engineering required.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Yes. Start with our Starter plan and see if it fits. No credit card needed, no tricks. If it\'s not for you, walk away clean.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Our Enterprise plan includes custom integrations and a dedicated account manager who works with your team. Reach out and we\'ll talk through what you need.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=We encrypt everything in transit and at rest. We\'re SOC 2 compliant and audit regularly. Your data is yours, and we treat it that way.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Yes. Starter plans get email support. Professional and Enterprise get priority support and direct access to our team. We\'re here when you need us.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Get in touch').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=hello@productflowstudio.com').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=+1 (415) 555-0100').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=415 Mission Street, San Francisco CA 94105').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Level 2, 50 Bridge Street, Sydney NSW 2000').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=1800 567 890').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=hello@productflow.com').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=© 2025 ProductFlow Studio. All rights reserved.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Privacy policy').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Terms of service').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Cookie settings').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: FE-002-Navigation Menu
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8080", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Verify that each navigation menu item is clickable by clicking each one and checking for page changes or navigation.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Features' menu item to verify it is clickable
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/nav/div/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on the next navigation menu item 'Pricing' to verify it is clickable.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Pricing' menu item to verify it is clickable
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/nav/div/div/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on the next navigation menu item 'Blog' to verify it is clickable.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on 'Blog' menu item to verify it is clickable
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/nav/div/div/a[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Features').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Pricing').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Blog').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Resources').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Demo').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: FE-003-Hero CTA Button
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8080", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Click the 'Start' button in the hero section to verify it is clickable and leads to the correct section.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the 'Start' button in the hero section to test clickability and navigation
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/main/section/div/div/div/div[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Nonexistent Call To Action Text').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test failed: The hero section call-to-action button is either not clickable or does not lead to the correct section as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: FE-004-Features Section
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8080", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll down to the features section to verify all features are displayed and check their styling.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 800)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Features').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Sync').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Insight').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Move').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: FE-005-Pricing Plans
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8080", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll down to the pricing section to verify all pricing tiers and check pricing cards layout.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to reach the pricing section and verify pricing tiers and layout.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to reach the pricing section and verify pricing tiers and layout.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to reach the pricing section and verify pricing tiers and layout.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Use the navigation link 'Pricing' at index 2 to jump directly to the pricing section for verification.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the 'Pricing' navigation link to jump to the pricing section
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/nav/div/div/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Simple pricing').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Starter plan').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=$19/mo').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=or $199 yearly').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Professional plan').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=$29/mo').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=or $499 yearly').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Enterprise plan').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=$49/mo').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=or $999 yearly').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: FE-006-FAQ Accordion
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8080", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll down to the FAQ section to locate FAQ items.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll further down to locate the FAQ section and its accordion items.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to locate the FAQ section and its accordion items.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to locate the FAQ section and its accordion items.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to locate the FAQ section and its accordion items.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to locate the FAQ section and its accordion items.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to locate the FAQ section and its accordion items.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Check if FAQ section is accessible via navigation or resources menu or other interactive elements.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Resources' button to check if FAQ section is under resources menu
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/nav/div/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click on each FAQ item to test accordion expand and collapse functionality.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click 'Resources' button to ensure FAQ section is visible
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/nav/div/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click first FAQ item 'How long is setup?' to expand
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/nav/div/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click first FAQ item 'How long is setup?' again to collapse
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/nav/div/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Identify and click on actual FAQ accordion items to test expand and collapse functionality.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 500)
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click first FAQ question to test accordion expand/collapse
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/main/section[2]/div/div[2]/div/img').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=FAQ Accordion Test Passed').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test plan execution failed: FAQ accordion functionality test did not complete successfully. The accordion did not expand or collapse as expected, or FAQ items were not accessible.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: FE-007-Contact Form
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8080", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll down to the contact section to locate the contact form.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll further down to locate the contact form fields for filling.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to locate the contact form fields for filling.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to locate the contact form fields for filling.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to locate the contact form fields for filling.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Click on the 'Contact' link in the navigation to go directly to the contact section.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click on the 'Contact' link in the navigation to go to the contact section
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/footer/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Form submission successful! Thank you for contacting us.').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The contact form submission feedback was not found, indicating the form submission did not succeed as expected.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: FE-008-Newsletter Subscription
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8080", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll to newsletter section, enter email, submit form, and verify confirmation.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1200)
        

        # -> Enter email address into newsletter subscription input and click subscribe button.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Enter email address into newsletter subscription input
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/main/section[10]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('test@example.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click subscribe button to submit newsletter subscription form
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/main/section[10]/div/div/div/div[2]/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Stay in the loop').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Subscribe').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: FE-009-Testimonials Carousel
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8080", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll down to the testimonials section to verify carousel display.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1200)
        

        # -> Scroll further down to locate the testimonials carousel section.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1000)
        

        # -> Scroll down further to locate the testimonials carousel section.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1200)
        

        # -> Locate and click the carousel next navigation button to test carousel navigation.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the next carousel navigation button to test carousel navigation
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/main/section[5]/div/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/img').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click the carousel previous navigation button to test backward navigation.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click the previous carousel navigation button to test carousel backward navigation
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/main/section[5]/div/div[2]/div/div[2]/img').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=Carousel Navigation Successful').first).to_be_visible(timeout=30000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: The testimonials carousel did not display or navigate as expected. The expected carousel navigation confirmation text "Carousel Navigation Successful" was not found on the page.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:8080", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Scroll to the footer to verify footer content and check if footer links are clickable.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, 1200)
        

        # -> Check if footer links are clickable by clicking each footer link one by one.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click footer link Home to verify it is clickable
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/footer/div/div/div[2]/div/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click footer link 'Features' to verify it is clickable.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click footer link Features to verify it is clickable
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/footer/div/div/div[2]/div/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click the 'Pricing' footer link to verify it is clickable and navigates correctly.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click footer link Pricing to verify it is clickable
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/footer/div/div/div[2]/div/a[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # -> Click the 'Blog' footer link to verify it is clickable and navigates correctly.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click footer link Blog to verify it is clickable
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/footer/div/div/div[2]/div/a[4]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        try:
            await expect(frame.locator('text=This text does not exist in the footer or anywhere on the page').first).to_be_visible(timeout=1000)
        except AssertionError:
            raise AssertionError('Test case failed: Footer links and information verification failed as the test plan execution did not complete successfully.')
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
